Two doctors were asked to report 100 X- rays and Kappa value 0.71; what is interpretation?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The widely accepted interpretation of Kappa values is:
  • • < 0.00 = Poor agreement 0.00 – 0.20 = Slight agreement 0.21 – 0.40 = Fair agreement 0.41 – 0.60 = Moderate agreement 0.61 – 0.80 = Substantial agreement (Good) 0.81 – 1.00 = Almost perfect agreement (Very good)
  • • < 0.00 = Poor agreement
  • • < 0.00 = Poor agreement
  • • 0.00 – 0.20 = Slight agreement
  • • 0.00 – 0.20 = Slight agreement
  • • 0.21 – 0.40 = Fair agreement
  • • 0.21 – 0.40 = Fair agreement
  • • 0.41 – 0.60 = Moderate agreement
  • • 0.41 – 0.60 = Moderate agreement
  • • 0.61 – 0.80 = Substantial agreement (Good)
  • • 0.61 – 0.80 = Substantial agreement (Good)
  • • 0.81 – 1.00 = Almost perfect agreement (Very good)
  • • 0.81 – 1.00 = Almost perfect agreement (Very good)

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about this standard distribution?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
